arm_group.description: Participants in this group are measured on primary and secondary outcome measures before and after a 12 week extensive pulmonary rehabilitation program.

Participants in the waiting list control group are measured on primary and secondary outcome measures before and after waiting time for the extensive pulmonary rehabilitation program and start with this program after the second moment of measurement.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this project is to investigate whether a 12-week, fulltime pulmonary
      rehabilitation program can enhance cognitive functioning, mood, anxiety, and quality of life
      in patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD).

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation: Effects on Cognitive Functioning, Mood, Anxiety, and Quality of Life in Patients With COPD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  COPD

          -  Referral to the Extensive Pulmonary Rehabilitation Program

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Unfinished primary school

          -  Referral to the Compact Pulmonary Rehabilitation Program

intervention.description: Fulltime pulmonary rehabilitation program. Duration: 12 weeks

facility.name: Revant Schoondonck Center for Pulmonary Rehabilitation

clinical_study.official_title: Pulmonary Rehabilitation: Effects on Cognitive Functioning, Mood, Anxiety, and Quality of Life in Patients With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)

primary_outcome.description: CNS-Vital Signs, computerized neuropsychological assessment WMS - Verbal Paired Associates Direct Recall Word fluency-category (GIT): animals & profession Letter fluency: D-A-T Purdue Pegboard
primary_outcome.time_frame: In the experimental group, this measure is assessed in the first and last week of rehabilitation with an average time frame of 11 weeks. In the Control group, this measure is assessed before and after waiting time with an average time frame of 5 weeks.

primary_outcome.description:
Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)
Symptom Checklist 90 - Revised (SCL-90-R), subscales Anxiety, Depression, Agoraphobia
primary_outcome.time_frame: In the experimental group, this measure is assessed in the first and last week of rehabilitation with an average time frame of 11 weeks. In the Control group, this measure is assessed before and after waiting time with an average time frame of 5 weeks.

primary_outcome.description:
Saint George Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ)
SF-36 Health Survey
primary_outcome.time_frame: In the experimental group, this measure is assessed in the first and last week of rehabilitation with an average time frame of 11 weeks. In the Control group, this measure is assessed before and after waiting time with an average time frame of 5 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in 6 Minute Walking distance Test(6-MWT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: In the experimental group, this measure is assessed in the first and last week of rehabilitation with an average time frame of 11 weeks. In the Control group, this measure is assessed before and after waiting time with an average time frame of 5 weeks.

In the experimental group, this measure is assessed in the first and last week of rehabilitation with an average time frame of 11 weeks. In the Control group, this measure is assessed before and after waiting time with an average time frame of 5 weeks.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Percentage of attendance of treatment session is collected from patients medical records.
Adherence to pulmonary rehabilitation is specified as the percentage of the prescribed treatment sessions that patients actually attend. Adherence is further specified in the following categories: disease, motivation, other.
We use this measure to explore the predictors (e.g., age, education, cognitive functioning) of adherence to pulmonary rehabilitation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: These data are collected during the total period of pulmonary rehabilitation, which has a time frame of 12 weeks.

In the experimental group, this measure is assessed in the first and last week of rehabilitation with an average time frame of 11 weeks. In the Control group, this measure is assessed before and after waiting time with an average time frame of 5 weeks.

secondary_outcome.description:
Dropout can be specified as the percentage of patients who, though eligible, do not start pulmonary rehabilitation or patients who do not finish pulmonary rehabilitation. Dropout is further specified in the following categories: death, disease, motivation, practical (e.g. move).
We use this measure to explore the predictors (e.g., age, education, cognitive functioning) of dropout from pulmonary rehabilitation.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the moment of randomization untill the moment of dropout from pulmonary rehabilitation, assessed up to 1 year after randomization.

collaborator.agency: Revant Schoondonck Center for Pulmonary Rehabilitation Breda

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor)
